title.narrative: EDUCATION:PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Strengthened national education systems and partnerships to address equity and improve the educational status of children., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Regional support and inter-country initiatives contribute to the quality and impact of policy and programmes for the realization of all children's rights in the region, including in humanitarian situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national education systems and partnerships to address equity and improve the educational status of children.

description.narrative: The Second decade Ensuring Child Rights in Adolescence | Status:Discontinued | As-of Date:03/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of countries supported by UNICEF (RO+COs) which include social cohesion/peacebuilding components into key education policies, documents or sector Plans

actual.value: 2015:On-Track2: Philippines, Myanmar. Philippines: integrated in sector plan, key education & ECD policies and teacher training, Executive order on peace education, Myanmar: Education, language and ECD policies, laws, curriculum, teacher education & new Sector Plan influenced at national and state level

title.narrative: Number of countries supported by UNICEF (RO+COs) which include Education in Emergencies (EIE) components into key education policies, documents or sector Plans

actual.value: 2015:On-Track8 countries have integrated EiE in Sector Plans and Education Policies: Cambodia, China, Lao PDR, Philippines, Myanmar, Viet Nam, Pacific Islands, PNG. All countries/COs provided with capacity development and guidance on Resilience & Educ. 8 MoEs trained on integrating C/DRR to sector plans

title.narrative: Number of high quality education research, studies and/or documentation made public that promote improved equity and/or quality

actual.value: 2015:On-TrackDesk Review: of situation of Children with Disabilities in EAP, 3 policy documents on Language Education & Social Cohesion finalised, Resilience & Education guidance document finalized, Proposals, 2 symposia chaired and 6 papers presented at Oxford Conference (Sept 2015), 3 on partnerships

title.narrative: Number of countries supported by UNICEF (RO+COs) which include gender components into key education policies, documents or Sector Plans

actual.value: 2015:SRGBV curriculum piloted in Fiji as first step to scale up efforts related to SRGBV. Gender in Education Audit completed for PNG. Myanmar: supported gender analysis of Ed Sector plans and in education workshop and high level advocacy meetings with MOE and MOWSSR, Timor Leste: supporting gender an

title.narrative: Number of countries supported by UNICEF (RO+COs) to mainstream gender within inclusive education policies and approaches

actual.value: 2015:On-Track4: Lao PDR and Myanmar on Education Sector plans, PNG on gender audit, Timor Leste: integrating protection into education policies.

title.narrative: Number of countries supported by UNICEF (RO+COs) that use OOSCI findings for Policy Reform and/or Innovation

actual.value: 2015:On-Track6 countries endorsed National Steering Committees.Vietnam: A key achievement was Prime Minister's Directive on strengthening preschools and kindergarten classes in industrialized zones.
